concept.display: pNX category (finding)
pNX: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed (e.g., previously removed, or not removed for pathologic study) (breast)
pN0 category (finding)
pN0: No regional lymph node metastasis histologically (i.e., none greater than 0.2 mm), no additional examination for isolated tumor cells (breast) (finding)
Neoplasm of breast regional lymph node staging category pN0 as per American Joint Committee on Cancer 7th edition (finding)
pN1 category (finding)
pN1: Metastasis in 1 to 3 axillary lymph nodes, and/or in internal mammary nodes with microscopic disease detected by sentinel lymph node dissection but not clinically apparent (breast) (finding)
pN2 category (finding)
pN2: Metastasis in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes, or in clinically apparent internal mammary lymph nodes in the absence of axillary lymph node metastasis (breast)
pN2a: Metastasis in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes (at least one tumour deposit greater than 2.0 mm) (breast)
pN2a category (finding)
pN2b: Metastasis in clinically apparent internal mammary lymph nodes in the absence of axillary lymph node metastasis (breast)
pN2b category (finding)
pN3 category (finding)
Neoplasm of breast regional lymph node staging category pN3 as per American Joint Committee on Cancer 7th edition (finding)
pN3a: Metastasis in 10 or more axillary lymph nodes (at least one tumour deposit greater than 2.0 mm), or metastasis to infraclavicular lymph nodes (breast)
pN3a category (finding)
pN3b category (finding)
Neoplasm of breast regional lymph node staging category pN3b as per American Joint Committee on Cancer 7th edition (finding)
pN3b: Tumour of breast with metastasis as per AJCC 6th Edition definition (breast)
pN3c category (finding)
pN3c: Metastasis in ipsilateral supraclavicular lymph nodes (breast)
